If you haven't already, you will need to: Če še niste, boste morali prenesti elementary OS z naše spletne strani. S spodnjimi napotki si lahko pomagate pri kopiranju prenešene ISO datoteke na USB pomnilniški ključek.
Intel i3 or comparable dual-core 64-bit: Intel i3 ali primerljiv dvojedrni 64-bitni procesor
Make sure to back your important data up: Poskrbite, da shranite varnostno kopijo pomembnih podatkov na zunanji trdi disk ali oblačno storitev. Vaši že obstoječi podatki se lahko izgubijo med nameščanjem novega operacijskega sistema.
Select the operating system you are curr: Izberite vaš trenutni operacijski sistem, da vam lahko ponudimo navodila za namestitev za vaš sistem.
You'll need a USB flash drive with at le: Potrebovali boste USB ključek z vsaj 2 GB kapacitete ter program Rufus
Insert your USB drive and select it in t: Vstavite vaš USB ključek v računalnik in ga, v programu Rufus, izberite v seznamu "Naprave"
Select &quot;ISO Image&quot; next to &qu: Izberite "Slika ISO" poleg "Ustvari zagonski pogon z ..."
to choose the ISO that you downloaded pr: da izberete ISO, katerega ste pred tem prenesli.
We generate a checksum (or hash sum) for: We generate a checksum (or hash sum) for elementary OS images so you can verify your downloaded file. This ensures that you've received the full, complete download and that your install image is not corrupted in any way. Click the # button in the status bar and verify that the text next to "SHA256" matches the following hash:
If the hashes match, click &quot;Start&q: If the hashes match, click "Start" and wait for the process to finish.
In order to start the installation proce: In order to start the installation process, you must boot your computer from the install drive.
Assuming that your computer is still on,: Predvideno, da je tvoj računalnik še vedno prižgan, vtakni namestitveni medij in ponovno zaženi računalnik.
Most computers will briefly allow you to: Most computers will briefly allow you to change the boot order for this boot only by pressing a special key — usually <kbd>F12</kbd>, but sometimes <kbd>Esc</kbd> or another function key. Refer to the screen or your computer's documentation to be sure.
Press <kbd>F12</kbd> (or the appropriate: Press <kbd>F12</kbd> (or the appropriate key) and select the install drive—usually "USB-HDD" or something containing the word "USB", but the wording may vary. If you choose the incorrect drive, your computer will likely continue to boot as normal. Just restart your computer and pick a different drive in that menu.
Shortly after selecting the appropriate: Shortly after selecting the appropriate boot drive, you should be presented with the elementary OS splash screen. You may now follow the on-screen instructions which will guide you through the rest of the process.
Verifying your download is an important,: Verifikacija vašega prenosa je pomemben in priporočan, a hkrati poljuben korak pri namestitvi. Ko posodobimo našo programsko opremo, izračunamo kontrolno vsoto (ali hash) za elementary OS ter jo objavimo skupaj z distribucijo. Ko je vaš prenos označen za končan, vam priporočamo, da preverite, ali se naša objavljena kontrolna vsota ujema z vašo izračunano. Tako lahko zagotovimo, da ste pridobili nepoškodovano ter celostno različico elementary OS.

Note: This is assuming that you have downloaded the .iso file to your Downloads folder.
In case you have downloaded it elsewhere, please specify the correct path to the downloaded file, as shown below
To create an elementary OS install drive: To create an elementary OS install drive on macOS you'll need a USB flash drive that is at least 2 GB in capacity and an app called "Etcher".
Insert the spare USB drive, and select t: Insert the spare USB drive, and select the ISO file you've just downloaded.
Open &quot;Etcher&quot; and select your: Open "Etcher" and select your downloaded elementary OS image file using the "Select image" button.
Etcher should automatically detect your: Etcher should automatically detect your USB drive, but check to see if it has selected the correct target.
Start the flashing process by clicking t: Start the flashing process by clicking the "Flash!" button. It will take a moment to get started.
When complete it will be safe to remove: When complete it will be safe to remove the drive and attempt to boot to install elementary OS.
The following dialog may appear during t: The following dialog may appear during the flashing process, it is safe to ignore.
After you hear the chime, press and hold: After you hear the chime, press and hold <kbd>Option</kbd>. Then, select the appropriate boot drive. Note that it may be incorrectly identified as "Windows", but this is normal.
If your Mac doesn't recognize your eleme: If your Mac doesn't recognize your elementary OS USB Install Drive in the boot menu, you may need to create an elementary OS Install DVD instead. To create one, insert a blank DVD, right click on the ISO file in Finder, and select "Burn elementaryos-0.4-stable-amd64.20160921.iso to Disc". When complete, attempt to boot again from the Install DVD.
Running the following command in your te: Running the following command in your terminal:
You'll need a USB flash drive with at le: You'll need a USB flash drive with at least 2 GB of free space and a program called UNetbootin.
Open UNetbootin from the Dash. It will o: Open UNetbootin from the Dash. It will open a window like the one below:
Click &quot;…&quot; to select the ISO th: Click "…" to select the ISO that you downloaded previously.
Unplug all USB memory devices apart from: Unplug all USB memory devices apart from the one you want to use.
Click &quot;OK&quot; and wait for the pr: Click "OK" and wait for the process to finish.
Take this time to read the <a href=\"/do: Take this time to read the getting started guide to learn about your new operating system.
